intro: Cascoelytrum, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble cups, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a woody stem and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Cascoelytrum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and wetland restoration projects.
